title: Domain 1.2: Given a scenario, use the appropriate Microsoft command-line tool.
content:
ğŸ§­ 1.2 â€“ Navigation Commands (Windows CLI)

  • cd â€“ Change directory
    Example: cd Documents
  • dir â€“ List contents of current directory
  • md or mkdir â€“ Make a new folder
    Example: md NewFolder
  • rmdir or rd â€“ Remove empty folder
    Example: rmdir OldFolder
  • Drive navigation â€“ Switch drives
    Example: C: or D:

ğŸ› ï¸ Core Command-Line Tools

  • ipconfig â€“ IP info
    Example: ipconfig /all
  • ping â€“ Test connectivity
    Example: ping google.com
  • hostname â€“ Show computer name
  • netstat â€“ List network connections and ports
  • nslookup â€“ DNS troubleshooting
    Example: nslookup google.com
  • chkdsk â€“ Scan/fix disk errors
    Example: chkdsk /f
  • net user â€“ Manage user accounts
    Example: net user John /add
  • net use â€“ Map network drive
    Example: net use Z: \\Server\Share
  • tracert â€“ Trace route
    Example: tracert google.com
  • format â€“ Format a drive
    Example: format E:

ğŸ§± File Management & Utilities

  • xcopy â€“ Copy folders and subfolders
    Example: xcopy C:\Source D:\Backup /s /e
  • copy â€“ Simple file copy
    Example: copy file.txt D:\
  • robocopy â€“ Reliable bulk copy tool
    Example: robocopy C:\Data D:\Backup /MIR

ğŸ§  System Updates & Info

  • gpupdate â€“ Refresh Group Policy
    Example: gpupdate /force
  • gpresult â€“ Show applied policies
    Example: gpresult /r

ğŸ”Œ System & Disk Utilities

  • shutdown â€“ Restart/shut down system
    Example: shutdown /r /t 0
  • sfc â€“ System File Checker
    Example: sfc /scannow
  • [command] /? â€“ Show command help
    Example: xcopy /?
  • diskpart â€“ Disk partitioning tool
  • pathping â€“ Traces and tests latency/loss
  • winver â€“ Show Windows version window
